profileText: a Representative from Louisiana; born in Baton Rouge, East Baton Rouge Parish, La., November 22, 1962; graduated from McKinley High School, Baton Rouge, La., 1980; B.A., Southern University, 1984, J.D., Southern University Law Center, 1987; nonprofit executive; lawyer, private practice; unsuccessful candidate for election to the One Hundred Second Congress in 1990; member of the Louisiana state senate, 1988-1993 1997-2008, 2019-2024; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 1993-January 3, 1997); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fifth Congress in 1996; unsuccessful candidate for election for Governor of Louisiana in 1995; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Nineteenth Congress (January 3, 2025-present).

asset.name: F000110_001
asset.creditLine: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: "Cleo Fields" in Black Americans in Congress, 1870-2007. Prepared under the direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History & Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Printing Office, 2008.

researchRecord.name: 1990, 4 commercials on 1 videocassette.
researchRecord.description: The commercials were used during Cleo Fields's campaign for the 1990 U.S. congressional election in District 8 of Louisiana, Democratic Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication
